Articles.Content:
It started out innocently enough - I just wanted to take advantage of the transfer window to Eve in order to set up a colony. Then things started getting out of hand, five launches turned to ten then twenty then thirty because you know - I had to make sure I had everything, the transfer window was coming up right away and I didn't want to miss it; I would have to wait almost a whole year for the next one (gasp).

![GpJv44e.png](http://i.imgur.com/GpJv44e.png)

The arrival at Eve wasn't quite so orderly and was more reminiscent of an invasion rather than exploration or even colonization.

 ![3qplhNf.png](http://i.imgur.com/3qplhNf.png)

I sent a bunch of probes first of course because you need to be able to harvest that data.

![KG2Qa1g.png](http://i.imgur.com/KG2Qa1g.png)

A fuel depot is an absolute necessity.

![5A6NaVo.png](http://i.imgur.com/5A6NaVo.png)

A small outpost on Gilly (I still need to get that module the right way up).

![7SoOAyB.png](http://i.imgur.com/7SoOAyB.png)

And of course Gilly needs it's own space station as well.

![TcuW2t6.png](http://i.imgur.com/TcuW2t6.png)

The large base on Eve was the most difficult and time consuming thing I've ever built.

![E3aYnRk.png](http://i.imgur.com/E3aYnRk.png)

And just for good measure I added a smaller outpost close by as well.

![g1qwxvq.png](http://i.imgur.com/g1qwxvq.png)

I guess the most impressive thing I built was the space station. I called it Armenia after "The Who" song "Armenia City in the Sky".

![wUgd7xO.png](http://i.imgur.com/wUgd7xO.png)

And in the end it was all pretty much unnecessary, simply causing the game to get laggy and I ended up getting burnt out and putting it down for a while (of course the GF said I wasn't spending enough time with her, that may have had something to do with it as well). The game is designed to have single flight for each contract, and move on to the next. That's how it works best so let this be a lesson for all you kids...

Don't get to crazy on the colonization it will MESS YOU UUUUUUUUP!

![03Y3vnF.png](http://i.imgur.com/03Y3vnF.png)

If you want to play this scenario for yourself in KSP V1.0.4 I've posted the quick save here: 

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/4fb25qm8myxljxn/EVEquicksave.sfs?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/4fb25qm8myxljxn/EVEquicksave.sfs?dl=0)

Simply create a Sandbox game named "Eve", and download the file into the **...KSP\_win\saves\Eve** directory and rename it to "**quicksave.sfs**". Play the Eve game and hold F9 for three seconds to reload the quicksave and you're there.

Some parts have changed between the time I did this and the latest version so a few craft won't work quite right, but I've cleaned up most of the broken stuff. I would recommend using all of the remaining bases on Gilly - Eve is just too much work to try to build another base. Besides, it's bad enough that all the Kerbals already on the planet are stranded there...

JR

I thought I was bad for the 7th launch for my outposts arriving first, and me almost forgetting about the first launch on the slow efficient transfer. (I get impatient! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif))

> 
> I thought you must run into the trouble of two ships entering atmosphere at overlapping times?

Yeah, too many craft flying areobraking and requiring maneuvers at the same time is way more work than it's worth. It's actually surprising how spread out the flights get - they all left Kerbin at pretty much the same time but variations in the orbit caused them to arrive at much different times and even angles of entry for the Eve SOI. I did it and trust me, it's better to build your colonies one flight at a time. Build a kick ass space station, and base and all of that, just do it in stages that's my recommendation. 

I checked the persistent.sfs and it was at just over 9Mb. The save was for Eve only, all other flights were deleted.

JR
